result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Cruz-Rivera

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Violation (DISCHARGE) Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant William Cruz-Rivera in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for William Cruz-Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant William Cruz-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Cruz-Rivera in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia who appeared as a friend of the court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Attorney Cerniglia requests a status conference date and will look into who will be appearing as counsel from the public defenders office.  If attorney Cerniglia requests a bail hearing prior to next court date, Court ordered attorney Cerniglia to contact the court to select a date.  Case adjourned, Br. 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with LR.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant William Cruz-Rivera in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant William Cruz-Rivera in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
